  - Email change confirmation with security warnings
  - User invitation with platform overview

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add all 5 predefined collections to admin collections management page

This commit ensures all 5 historical collections are always visible in
the admin collections management interface, even when they have no pages.

Collections added:
- African Colonization Society (acs)
- Slave Compensation Claims (slave-compensation)
- Inspection Roll of Negroes (inspection-roll)
- Confederate Payrolls (confederate-payrolls)
- Slave Voyages (slave-voyages)

- Predefined collections list with descriptions
- Merged with dynamic database counts
- Shows page count for each collection (0 if empty)
- Descriptions displayed in collection sidebar
- Additional collections from database still supported

whether pages already exist, improving the content management workflow.

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Add table type differentiation to admin collections management

This commit enhances the admin collections interface to properly
handle different table types and show appropriate management options
for each collection type.

Changes:
- Added tableType property to collections (archive_pages, database tables, coming_soon)
- Collections now fetch counts from multiple table types:
  - archive_pages (for document-based collections)
  - slave_compensation_claims
  - emmigrants_to_liberia
  - liberation_census_rolls
- Visual indicators show table type (DB badge, Soon badge)
- Smart content display based on collection type:
  - archive_pages: Full page management interface
  - Database tables: Info panel with link to Supabase and public view
  - Coming Soon: Placeholder message

Benefits:
- Admins can see all 27 collections with correct record counts
- Clear indication of which collections use which data structure
- Database-backed collections show record counts instead of page counts
- Direct links to Supabase for database table management
- "Coming Soon" collections clearly marked

This provides transparency about the data architecture and appropriate
management tools for each collection type.

EOF
